page.title: 14BENENDEN WEALD, LABOUR.
page.content: When Forest Farm was bought in 1946 its 28 hectares were farmed by the farmer and his wife with the help of a prisoner of war. The labour intensity therefore was 1 person:9.4 hectares. By 1976 the farm had increased to 120 hectares and the farmer's two sons were employed in charge of the dairy management and machinery maintenance and management. The farmer does the buying, selling and milling and his wife helps with the book-keeping and also looks after the calves. A student helps with the afternoon milking. The farm has now increased to 160 hectares and a tractor driver is employed. Although the labour force has increased the larger size of the farm means that the labour intensity is now reduced to 1 person :2.3 hectares as a result of mechanization.
